definition: to go on a scenic tour
to walk/to tour/to roam/to travel
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Long, long ago, there is a student who likes to travel.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，有個讀書人喜歡遊山玩水。

sentences.english: You may get the chance to travel both for work and for pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 你有出差的機會，同時也可以遊山玩水。

sentences.english: He made the most of his spare time in Hawaii touring the scenic spots.
sentences.chinese: 他利用在夏威夷的閒暇充分遊山玩水。

sentences.english: The goal of pilgrimages is beyond sightseeing.
sentences.chinese: 朝聖的目的是超越一般的遊山玩水。

sentences.english: Visiting places is really a good idea to keep fit.
sentences.chinese: 遊山玩水的確是保持健康的好主意。

sentences.english: They are enjoying the selves at other places when we found this problem.
sentences.chinese: 當我們發現這個問題的時候，他們正在外地遊山玩水。

definition: to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
leisure/free time/unoccupied/not in use
(Tw) from time to time/frequently
leisurely and comfortable/relaxed
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
family love and joy/domestic bliss
to chat
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
